title: Grandma's Orange Rolls with Orange Cream Cheese Frosting

Ingredients.3: 0.25 cup warm water (105 - 115 degrees F; 40 - 45 degrees C)

Ingredients.4: 0.75 cup warm orange juice (105 - 115 degrees F; 40 - 45 degrees C)

Ingredients.5: 0.25 cup warm milk (105 - 115 degrees F; 40 - 45 degrees C)

Ingredients.10: 2.25 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed

Directions.1: Dissolve yeast in warm water and warm orange juice in a bowl. Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes.

Directions.2: Beat warm milk, shortening, 1/4 cup white sugar, egg, and salt together in a separate bowl. Stir yeast mixture into milk mixture. Add enough flour to mixture to create a soft dough. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6 to 8 minutes.

Directions.3: Grease a large bowl and two 11x7x2-inch baking sheets.

Directions.4: Place dough in the greased bowl and turn dough to coat all sides. Cover bowl with plastic wrap or a clean towel and let rise in a warm place until dough is doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Directions.5: Punch dough down and divide in half. Roll each half on a lightly floured surface creating two 15x10-inch rectangles.

Directions.6: Mix sugar, softened butter, and orange zest in a bowl until filling is smooth. Spread half of the filling onto each dough rectangle. Roll each rectangle around the filling, jelly roll-style, starting with the long end creating a log. Cut each log into 15 rolls.

Directions.7: Arrange rolls on the prepared baking sheets. Cover baking sheets with plastic wrap and let rolls rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.

Directions.8: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Remove plastic wrap from baking sheets.

Directions.9: Bake rolls in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes.

Directions.10: Beat confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, softened butter, orange juice, and orange zest in a bowl until frosting is smooth. Spread frosting on the warm rolls.
